elements.name: Auftrag
elements.title: In the following examples, does the buyer or the seller have to bear the additional costs incurred? Give reasons for your answer and state the article of law on which you base your answer.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Eveline Enderbizzin buys a new office chair online. When she receives the chair, she discovers that CHF 40 in transportation costs have been added to the purchase price.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: As nothing else has been agreed, Mrs. Enderbizzin as the buyer must pay the transport costs of CHF 40.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What would apply if, in the example above, the seller of the office chair had promised a franco delivery?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: In this case, it is assumed that the seller will bear the transportation costs.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Article:

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: In the following examples, does the buyer or the seller have to bear the additional costs incurred? Give reasons for your answer and state the article of law on which you base your answer.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Your parents buy a detached house. The public notarization of the property purchase contract costs CHF 3000.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: The buyer must bear the costs of the notarization unless otherwise agreed.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: Article:

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: In the following examples, does the buyer or the seller have to bear the additional costs incurred? Give reasons for your answer and state the article of law on which you base your answer.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: You buy a second-hand scooter. Because you are concerned that the engine may no longer be in perfect working order, you have the scooter checked by a mechanic immediately after delivery. The mechanic finds no defects, but sends you an invoice for CHF 200 for his work.

elements.name: question11
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: The costs of the inspection are part of the acceptance costs. Unless otherwise agreed, the buyer must pay these.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: Article:

elements.name: panel4
elements.title: In the following examples, does the buyer or the seller have to bear the additional costs incurred? Give reasons for your answer and state the article of law on which you base your answer.

elements.name: question13
elements.title: You order a book online. The bookseller will charge you CHF 5 for shipping.

elements.name: question14
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: Unless otherwise agreed or customary, you must bear the shipping costs.
